message_1:
A company wants to connect 6 cities with a network of roads. The cost of building a road between two cities is proportional to the distance between them. The distances (in km) between the cities are given in the matrix below:

|    | City 1 | City 2 | City 3 | City 4 | City 5 | City 6 |
|----|--------|--------|--------|--------|--------|--------|
| 1  |  --    |   8    |   20   |   30   |   25   |   15   |
| 2  |   8    |   --   |   12   |   18   |   21   |   24   |
| 3  |   20   |   12   |   --   |   22   |   20   |   17   |
| 4  |   30   |   18   |   22   |   --   |   10   |   30   |
| 5  |   25   |   21   |   20   |   10   |   --   |   28   |
| 6  |   15   |   24   |   17   |   30   |   28   |   --   |

What is the minimum cost to build a network of roads that connects all 6 cities?
message_2:
To find the minimum cost to build a network of roads that connects all 6 cities, we can use Kruskal's algorithm or Prim's algorithm. Both algorithms are used to find the minimum spanning tree of a connected, undirected graph with weighted edges. In this case, the cities are the vertices, and the distances between them are the edge weights.

I will use Kruskal's algorithm:

1. Sort all the edges in ascending order of their weights.
2. Start with an empty graph to build the minimum spanning tree.
3. Add the edges to the graph in the sorted order, making sure that adding the edge does not form a cycle in the graph.
4. Continue adding edges until all the vertices are connected.

Sorted edges:
(1, 2) - 8
(4, 5) - 10
(1, 6) - 15
(3, 6) - 17
(2, 3) - 12
(2, 4) - 18
(3, 5) - 20
(1, 3) - 20
(1, 5) - 25
(2, 5) - 21
(3, 4) - 22
(1, 4) - 30
(4, 6) - 30
(5, 6) - 28
(2, 6) - 24

Adding edges to the minimum spanning tree:
(1, 2) - 8
(4, 5) - 10
(1, 6) - 15
(3, 6) - 17
(2, 3) - 12

The minimum spanning tree now connects all 6 cities. The minimum cost to build the network of roads is the sum of the edge weights in the minimum spanning tree:

8 + 10 + 15 + 17 + 12 = 62

The minimum cost to build a network of roads that connects all 6 cities is 62 km.
